name: Mrs V
text: Everything is delicious! Get a board and try various cheeses and meats. There is no better place in B’Ham to get a hot sandwich and everything they pickle is amazing. Also, you don’t have to go to Augusta to get delicious pimento cheese! Call them to caterer a board for your next event! The staff is very accommodating.

name: Tony Largin
text: THEY MAKE GREAT PICKLES. We bought three jars and will stop by again, I just hope they have more pickles.

name: David Nomberg
text: Don't get boxed lunches or the same old sandwich trays for your office lunch. Brian and crew recently catered 2 lunches at our office. They deliver, set up and pick up. Plenty of food. Meat and non-meat options available. All are delicious, plus pickles, pimento cheese, chips and drinks. Our guests loved it. Excellent food.

name: D. Chase Rosenbaum-Callahan
text: I give this place 5 out of 5 stars! I had the Alpine sandwich. Just reading the menu, one might think it’s simply a fancy grilled cheese, but don’t be fooled. It’s so much more. The cheeses are delicious and have nice pull. The sourdough bread is perfectly tasted and has a nice toothsomeness to it. And the caramelized onions - Oh my goodness! Out of this world delicious. Needless to say, I will be back for more.

name: Giant Slayer
text: I love the fresh selections of cheeses and meats from local sellers! The owner and his staff do an excellent job pairing the flavors to your taste buds! You can never go wrong with a 3 and 2 cheeseboard!

name: Kristi Tanner
text: We wanted to make an assortment of cheese and meats but had no idea what we wanted, and the men behind the counter spent twenty minutes with us letting us try cheeses and discussing what we liked. They were delightful and very helpful!

name: Jeffrey Cowgill
text:
The folks here are great! Not only are they friendly and knowledgeable they make some great sandwiches. Our other favorite is the charcuterie boards. Great selections of cured meats, fresh breads and cheeses. We have frequented Busy Corner many times since November of 2017 and will definitely be going back.

Urban Cowgill
May 2018

name: Jeffery Cannon
text: Food was really good and portion was larger than expected for price.

name: Tom Brander
text: Great locally own store with a fun assortment of food, skin care and other items, great for gifting or for yourself. A mix of locally sourced and imported goods. Most items would be hard to find elsewhere and many are produced on the premises.

name: Carrie Rollwagen
text:
The Pantry is a really lovely place to spend a meal or pick up quick, fresh food. Each day, they make fantastic meals out of organic, really healthy local food. It's true that some of the entrees can be kind of small, but the staff is really familiar with their menu, and they're honest about which meals are filling and which are lighter. The best thing is to let the staff know what you're in the mood for and ask them about their favorites (it's how I was introduced to their tomato tart, which is really outstanding).

The Pantry also makes fresh juice, and it all tastes amazing. I haven't studied the long-term benefits of juicing, but I know the juices here are delicious and make me feel great, so that's good enough for me. You can buy juice made that day out of the cooler or order something specific made while you wait.

This place is all about special little touches. The restaurant itself is small and incredibly charming, and they'll do things like serve free goat cheese samplers sometimes or serve cucumber water to add something special to every visit.

The Pantry also has a big selection of jams, cheeses, wine, beer and specialty items that make great treats or gifts for foodies. I haven't tried The Pantry for their waffle bar yet, but it's on my list after reading the other reviews.

name: Lee Harrison
text: Great healthy food prepared on site

name: Connie Settles
text: Please be mindful that they do not serve food anymore. Pleasant atmosphere, unique gift set.

name: Taylor King
text: I've lived in Birmingham for 3 years now and this is one of the best places to eat in the Ham. Hands down, must try this place. You can feel the organic-ness from the second you walk in. Go eat here.

name: Nathan English
text: Overpriced and not very good. Would definitely not recommend.

name: Roderick Williams
text: Service was awesome and the panini was great. The best chicken salad I have ever had

name: Lee Harrison
text: They ARE AWESOME

name: Wesley Ransom
text: Absolutely the best steaks you can buy. Little pricey but you will realize it's worth every penny after you take it off the grill. Be sure to get the finishing butter also.

name: Julia Peart
text: We really enjoyed our lunch. The meatloaf sandwich and Turkey club were so fresh and good...service is awesome, oh and we bought a huge loaf of bread to take home!

resp.text: We're so glad you enjoyed your visit! Please stop by again soon!

name: Gary Rush
text: Great food and great service. Environment is fun and staff make sure your satisfied with your order. First time visit, but will definitely return.

name: Kim Ouellette
text: The Italian sandwich is so good ( I heat it up)   big enough for two meals.   I love the crown filets...they cook up nicely and melt in your mouth.  Service with a smile.

name: Danny Neaves
text: Okay, I've heard a little bit about this place from word of mouth. Didn't realize they prepared food for you to eat on site. I thought they were only a butcher shop type of grocery store. They are a restaurant, and that is why I came by to try them out. I had a burger, and wow it was really good. It is a big burger, fresh, thick, and juicy. There are other sandwich style meals they offer with a variety of different meats and veggies. I will be back to get some cuts of meat to try out and to try some of the other sandwiches too. I have only had it the one time, but I would recommend it based on what I have had so far. Looking forward to trying some other stuff too!!

resp.text: Thanks for stopping in to check us out! We’re so glad you enjoyed your burger and hope you’ll stop back in again soon!

name: Tim Lowe
text: I drove through today to get lunch.  This cheeseburger is solid.  The people here are so nice, too.  I'm gonna make it a point to drive through here more often.

name: jettt111
text: We just had the Italian hoagies ( with their fresh made bread ) and heated up. It was the best sandwich I’ve ever had. Way more quality Meat and flavors than subway , I’ll get the hamburger next time. It’s unlike any other around

name: pJ Smitherman
text: The price for two usda prime filets was very high, considering I was unable to taste a difference from that of a grocery store chain usda prime steak. I overpaid expecting a better steak and was let down. Cant say I would make the trip to smiley brothers again. Staff was friendly but for $60 a lb I’ll try somewhere else next time.

name: Cre Hill
text: Best Burger I’ve had in a long time!! Fresh, seasoned and of great quality!

name: Julian king
text: Food is amazing. Service is impeccable. Not many places you go to that the owner is working the drive thru and greeting everyone. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Julian! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Cindy McRee
text: What a unique find! Dryed, aged beef! Unique cheeses you cannot hardly get anywhere else. Too many unique homemade items to mention such as pickles, sauerkraut, breads, etc. As must for an early evening of a glass of wine, a few cheeses, sliced meats and quality conversation with a friend or significant other.

resp.text: Thanks so much Cindy! We hope you’ll visit again soon :)

name: Life Is Brewtiful
text: I absolutely loved this place! The owner and sous chef we're incredibly helpful, attentive, and polite. They were very knowledgeable of their products, provided samples of anything requested and seemed to have a genuine passion for their profession. I loved being able to see the high end and made in house products be made either through the window into the kitchen or in their air drying system for their meats. The sandwiches we're absolutely delicious and made with an obviously higher caliber of product quality than you will find anywhere else in the area. And for the (on average) $10 you get chips and a drink as well. You can even call in and pick up your order at a later time! Now some people will say that the prices are too high, and to a point I agree. However, I also appreciate that this is a premium product with supurb quality which demands and justifes a higher price. Seems fair to me. In my opinion this place is too good for Pelham.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We're glad you decided to stop in and we hope you've enjoyed everything!

name: Robyn Arrieche
text: Let’s face it, they know what they are doing here. I had the Wagyu Pastrami sandwich toasted that was VERY good. However, my only critique was that there was an overpowering taste of saltiness coming from the mustard or the sauerkraut which was disappointing because the meat was soooo good.

name: Rick McCoy
text: Best in town. Bar none.

name: Doug Cole
text:
Went for the first time last night and wasn't disappointed.  Criss was extremely knowledgeable about the various cuts of meat and the dry aging process.  I felt like I was attending a culinary class.  The meal was excellent!
I'll definitely be back for seconds!

name: Taylor Hart
text: It was SO good. That Jon Green guy is a dream.  That meatloaf sandwich though.... it's a winner.

name: Danita Ryan
text: I stopped in from work at about 4:00 p.m. to grab a chicken salad sandwich. I rate it a 10, it was delicious and fresh. Smiley Brothers is a different place but when you walk in the door you know that you are about to receive great service and wonderful food. I recommend it to everyone. I love their customer service because if you don't know they have time to talk you through it and you can have it your way.

resp.text: Thank you for such a kind review! We’re so glad you enjoyed everything and hope you’ll stop by and see us again soon!

name: Dennis Tymkiw
text: Prime grade dry-aged steaks cut to order. Loaded baked potatoes ready to warm up and devour. They pickle their corned beef and make their own pastrami. Select cheese and wine. A jewel of a store with a knowledgeable staff. Foodies-don't miss this place.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Dennis!

name: Dennis Tymkiw
text: Prime grade dry-aged steaks cut to order. Loaded baked potatoes ready to warm up and devour. They pickle their corned beef and make their own pastrami. Select cheese and wine. A jewel of a store with a knowledgeable staff. Foodies-don't miss this place.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Dennis!

name: David Vaughn
text: Outstanding Italian beef sandwich today. Highly recommend

name: Christina Klockow Runnels
text: We have eaten there a few times and everything we have gotten has been delicious! Everything is fresh and seasoned perfectly and their cookies are out of this world! My favorite is the pimento cheese and my husband always gets the club sandwich. Looking forward to trying the chicken salad next! We are so lucky to have this gem in our town!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review! We’re so glad you liked what you tried and can’t wait to hear what you think of our house made chicken salad!

name: rene generoso
text: Great meat great cheese and great high prices haha

name: Marnie Reineke
text: Highly recommend if you are in the Birmingham area!  They prepared an amazing meal to go for our daughter’s soccer team and everyone enjoyed it. Terrific selection of delicious meats, cheeses  and other specialty foods  that works for one or a large group. Can’t say enough good things about both  the shop and the people who work there.

resp.text: Marnie, you're too kind! Thank you for such a thoughtful review, we're so glad you enjoyed your Smiley Brothers experience!

name: Darlene Talton
text:
Smiley Brothers has great deli sandwiches. They make most all of their ingredients on site. Everything is fresh made. They put plenty on your sandwich. They have a large selection of cheeses.
They do catering and cooler packages. Friendly and helpful employees.

resp.text: Thank you Darlene for your kind words!

name: Vintowsi Farms
text:
Traveling from Sacramento, California to Florida in an RV and stopped for a sandwich. Little did we know this would be the best sandwich of our trip!    So delish!
Criss knows quality, and he delivers that.
Wow, soooooo good and fresh!
Will stop again on our way back to Sacramento.

resp.text: We’re so glad you stopped by and that you loved your sandwich! THANK YOU!

name: QuantumPolagnus
text: My wife and I came here with no idea what they even sold.  We found out they sell lunch, so my wife got their Special Burger and I got a bowl of their Tomato Soup.  They showed us around and told us more about what they do as the food was being prepared.  Apparently the burger was a house recipe combination of different steaks ground together with butter, parsley, etc.  Suffice it to say that the burger was one of the best we have ever had.  The soup was also really good and creamy with shredded gouda and croutons on it.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review and for stopping by to give us a try! We so glad you enjoyed what you tried and hope you’ll come back and see us again soon!

name: Scott Lamoreaux
text: We have had almost every sandwich on the menu and each one has top quality Meats, cheese and bread. All of the take-home meats and items are as good as you will find in this area. Of course it's not cheap because it's the best. Also the only place I know of locally that has true dry aged beef.

resp.text: Hi Scott, thanks for the kind words! We're glad you've enjoyed the sandwiches and hope you'll come back and see us again soon!

name: Candace Herron
text: Great roast beef sandwich!  Also picked up some house made sausages and cheese.  I plan to come back for some dry aged steaks soon.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind review Candace!

name: Garrett Bowling
text: I finally branched out and tried something other than the beloved Meatloaf Sandwich....OMG am I glad I did because the Wagyu pastrami sandwich was AMAZING! The tangy house made pickles, cut through the rich fatty goodness of the Wagyu. The whole grain mustard and swiss cheese round out the flavors and it is served on wonderfully toasted Rye. Now the only problem I have is what to try next!

name: Chris Ashley
text: Bland sandwiches. Roast beef especially bad possibly expired or old.  Had club, roast beef, and chik salad.

name: Em
text: Wonderful place with friendly staff!

resp.text: Thanks Emily!

name: David Price
text: The staff was super friendly and helpful.  I had their cheese burger with a lettuce wrap instead of bun.  In my opinion, it is the best cheese burger in Shelby County.

resp.text: Thank you David for such a nice review! We’re so glad you enjoyed your burger!

name: Jonathan Eidson
text: The meat here is a premium product, so expect to pay a premium price. You’ll end up with a better steak from your own grill than you’d get at any place outside of a $100+ per plate fine dining restaurant for much less. The staff is friendly and willing to spend time discussing their products with you. Definitely will go to again for a fine steak dinner at home with the wife or other special meals.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review! Please come back and see us soon!

name: Tommy Barberini
text: Had an amazing sandwich but you better bring your appetite! Dry/wet aged meat available as well. Will definitely be back.

resp.text: Thanks Tommy! Hope you and your appetite are able to stop by again soon :)

name: Bill Burn
text: Had the Smiley Burger over the weekend and this is absolutely the best burger in bham! This thing is stacked tall and they apparently have butter in their beef mix! The cheddar is melted over the meat dripping down the toppings. They have lots of great sandwiches, but this is my new favorite! I would pit it against any burger in bham!! If you haven’t been in here yet, check it out. Great wine, cheese, and sandwiches. Chef Josh and the guys are always polite and helpful!

resp.text: Thank you Bill for such a kind review! We’re so glad you enjoyed your Smiley Brothers Burger!

name: garrett bowling
text: Never been here before today but I had the Meatloaf sandwich and it was INCREDIBLE! Will definitely be ordering it again!

resp.text: Thanks for stopping in and giving us a try! We’re so glad you loved your sandwich and look forward to seeing you again!

name: mhtate
text: Stopped in to pick up some sandwiches.   The wagyu pastrami was quite tasty but the cons Reuben was a bit too salty for our tastes.   I look forward to going back to try the good selection of cheeses, charcuterie, prepared foods and butcher cuts.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! The Reuben can definitely be a strong flavor! Hopefully you'll be able to stop back in soon and try out our other options!

name: Monique Smith
text: Very knowledgeable staff and owner. Wonderful quality, clean meat options. And when you're there check out the home made pimento cheese and french onion dip!!

resp.text: The French Onion Dip is a favorite all around, we're so glad you enjoyed it!

name: Eddie Stroud
text: Beyond friendly! The kind of old school freibdly helping hand that seems to be to few and far between nowadays. Mr. Smiley knows his meats. I will definitely be back again and highly suggest you visit if you haven't yet already! Great honemade oversized lunch specials. Nowhere anywhere close that can compare to this place.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Eddie! Hope you can come visit us again soon!

name: Owen Stayner/ThisWorkplace360
text: Had the BLT salad... excellent! Good service and nice space.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Owen! We’re so glad you enjoyed your experience!

name: Alabama Sedan
text: I really enjoyed my first visit to Smiley Brothers. Had no idea it was an excellent Deli as well as a butcher shop! I will definitely go back often to enjoy the ambience as well as the food.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review and we hope you can stop by again soon!

name: rene generoso
text: Great meat great cheese and great high prices haha

name: Lee Courington
text:
Amazing Experience! Staff took time to explain all menu items and the sandwich I had was delicious!

Highly recommend the pickles as well.

resp.text: Mmmmm, the pickles are definitely a fan favorite! Thank you for stopping in and we're so glad you enjoyed everything!

name: Ashley Winslett
text: Im new to the whole steak buying thing and honestly don't know what I'm doing. The people were so helpful. They answered my questions and never once made feel intimidated by the experience. The steaks were amazing! Looking forward to trying the deli. Keep up the great work.

resp.text: Thank you Ashley! We hope you stop in again soon!

name: kevin woody
text: the pimento burger is literally the best burger ive ever had.

name: Patrick Connor
text: Best burger in Shelby and maybe all of Bama

name: Austin Shadix
text: Friendly staff, quality products, lots of housemade goodies and ready to cook packages.

resp.text: Thanks Austin for such a kind review!

name: Eboni Greene
text: I love the smoked Gouda can't wait to make grilled cheese sandwiches. The staff was really nice and I will most definitely be returning.

resp.text: Thank you got your kind words Eboni! We hope the grilled cheese sandwiches were delish!

name: Sharon Kellum
text: Awesome new place if you are looking for a top quality butcher shop! Very knowledgeable owner and staff...

resp.text: Thank you! We hope you’re able to stop in again soon Sharon!

name: •GalaxyFloofy•
text: Amazing burgers and plenty of options!

name: Alan Thompson
text: Very nice selection of delicious cheeses and meats.

resp.text: We're so glad you enjoyed everything!

name: Michael Sims
text: Very friendly and informative. Did not make a purchase today, but will be back very soon.

name: John Kubas
text: very over priced......i bought a ribeye bone in from them....not good for the money i paid......much better ribeye on sale at piggly wiggly..

name: Lorraine Reeves
text:
From the moment you walk in, you are greeted by a friendly and helpful staff.  Fresh vegetables and any type of infused olive oils you can imagine.  The cheese display is incredible, and the staff is more than happy to give you a sample of any you would like to try.  Let's not forget the meat!  You can see the dry aging of beef in process.  It takes about thirty days to age the beef.  I bought a ready to cook meal that includes chunks of prime beef, carrots, onions, celery, potatoes, a half bulb of garlic, tomato paste and a red wine jus.  Cooked it in my dutch oven, and it was perfect.  I didn't have to cut up the vegetables or meat, so it was a great time-saver.  Did I mention the filets?  Bought two dry-aged and they grill to fork tender.  The flavor is certainly better than regular filets from the grocery store.  All meat is butchered in-house, by well-trained chefs and the house-made sausage is unique, yes classic.  I also bought pork chops that must have been over an inch thick.
I highly recommend you buy from this specialty food store!

resp.text: Lorraine, thank you SO MUCH for your incredibly kind words. We strive everyday to make sure each guest loves their Smiley Brother experience both in shop and once they take their purchases home. We hope you come back to see us soon!

name: preston naish
text: Stop what your doing and come eat here! Amazing food!!!!!

name: Marty Eagle Meaglesales@gmail.com
text: Food was awesome, just need a little more seating for guests

resp.text: Hi Marty! Thank you for your kind words and feedback! I hope you've stopped back in lately to see that we have added more seating for folks to enjoy in store!

name: Brad Satterfield
text: Nice dining, terribly over priced, my personal opinion it could be a great place if they had a wider selection

name: Em
text: Wonderful place with friendly staff!

resp.text: Thanks Emily!

name: Alabama Sedan
text: Great food an Facility

name: Mike Hamner
text: Superb meats, knowledgeable staff, awesome decor/style

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Kenneth Wesley
text: Profestional, Kind and Clean. My new home for all things meats, cheese and breads.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!

name: Ricky F
text: Great food!

name: Mark Watson
text: Wow is all i can say

resp.text: We hope that's a good wow :)

name: Pamela Pouncy
text: Excellent chili!

resp.text: Thanks Pamela!

name: Rebecca Hill
text: Great food!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Pat Reid
text: Bomb hero!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Josh Naro
text:
(Translated by Google) Great foody shop.

(Original)
Great foody shop.

resp.text: Thanks!
